gw.api.domain.accounting

Interface AbstractWriteOff<A extends ActivityCreatedByAppr>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ActivityApprovable<A>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AcctNegativeWriteoff, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.AcctNegativeWriteoffStubI, ChargeCommissionWriteoff, com.guidewire.bc.domain.commission.gen.ChargeCommissionWriteoffStubI, ChargeGrossWriteoff, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ChargeGrossWriteoffStubI, CommissionWriteoff, com.guidewire.bc.domain.commission.gen.CommissionWriteoffStubI, GrossWriteoff, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.GrossWriteoffStubI, ItemCommissionWriteoff, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ItemCommissionWriteoffStubI, ItemGrossWriteoff, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ItemGrossWriteoffStubI, NegativeWriteoff, ProdNegativeWriteoff, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ProdNegativeWriteoffStubI, ProdWriteoffContainer, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ProdWriteoffContainerStubI, Writeoff
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RawWriteOffTransactionView

    public interface AbstractWriteOff<A extends ActivityCreatedByAppr>
extends ActivityApprovable<A>
    Writeoff (Positive) and Negative Writeoff are not currently subclassed off of an abstract superclass, even though they both do many of the same things. This interface is to "hack" that relationship into place, until we have time to correctly revamp our write-offs structure.

    • Method Detail

      • getAmount

        MonetaryAmount getAmount()
        Returns:
        The amount written off

      • setReason

        void setReason(WriteoffReason reason)
        Parameters:
        reason - The reason to be associated with this write-off

      • getReason

        WriteoffReason getReason()
        Returns:
        The reason associated with this write-off

      • getTAccountOwner

        TAccountOwner getTAccountOwner()
        Returns:
        The TAccountOwner this write-off will apply to

      • getMaxPotentialWriteOffAmount

        MonetaryAmount getMaxPotentialWriteOffAmount()
        Returns:
        The maximum amount we could write-off, given the tAccountOwner of this write-off

      • doWriteOffWithApproval

        void doWriteOffWithApproval()
        Executes the write-off using the approval framework. Will result in an approval activity if the current user does not have authority to execute this write-off

      • getExecutionDate

        java.util.Date getExecutionDate()
        Returns:
        the date this write-off was executed, null if pending approval

      • getDisplayAmount

        MonetaryAmount getDisplayAmount()
        CommissionWriteoffs, ProdNegativeWriteoffs and AcctNegativeWriteoffs have the opposite point of view of all the other write-offs: a positive amount on a write-off typically means the carrier is losing money, but for commission write-offs it means the carrier will be gaining money.

        This method is intended to help ameliorate this inconsistency, by providing a getAmount method which always operates from the same (typical) point of view. In an ideal world, all write-offs would share the same point of view.

        This fix is filed under jira CC-60020. Upon completion of that jira, this method will no longer be needed.

        Returns:
        The amount of this write-off to be displayed to user, positive if the carrier will be losing money and negative if the carrier will be gaining money.

      • getWriteOffTarget

        KeyableBean getWriteOffTarget()
        Returns:
        The "target" entity for this write-off. For instance, an ItemGrossWriteoff will return the invoice item this write-off is targeting, a ChargeCommissionWriteoff will return the ChargeCommission, a ProducerUnappliedWriteoff will return the Producer, etc.

      • getWriteOffType

        java.lang.String getWriteOffType()
        Returns:
        A description of the write-off, for display purposes

      • reverse

        AbstractWriteOff reverse(com.guidewire.pl.web.navigation.Location location)
        Add the write-off to the current bundle, and calls reverse on it. Will check for reversal permissions.
        Parameters:
        location - The current location from which we are reversing this write-off
        Returns:
        The reversal created by reversing this write-off

      • isReversed

        java.lang.Boolean isReversed()
        Returns:
        true if this write-off has been reversed

      • isReversal

        boolean isReversal()
        Returns:
        true if this write-off is a reversal of a reversed write-off

      • isExecuted

        boolean isExecuted()
        Returns:
        true if this write-off is has been executed

      • getCreateTime

        java.util.Date getCreateTime()
        Returns:
        the creation time of this write-off

      • isPendingReversal

        boolean isPendingReversal()
        Returns:
        true if this write-off is pending reversal (the user who reversed the write-off did not have the needed authority, and there exists an open approval activity for the reversal of this write-off)

      • isPending

        boolean isPending()
        Returns:
        true if this write-off is pending (the user who made the write-off did not have the needed authority, and there exists an open approval activity for the execution of this write-off)

      • isRejected

        boolean isRejected()
        Returns:
        true if this write-off was rejected from being approved, false if it either hasn't been rejected, or approval wasn't necessary.
